pull.title: scripts: remove no-longer-needed ignored exports
pull.body:
Haven't checked which commit this changed (I assume the GCC-10 consolidation), however Guix builds no-longer require these exports to be ignored.

Guix Build (x86_64):

> Concept ACK (if this passes CI)

Note that in the CI we only run the security checks in a single macOS job. It's near impossible to run them in any of the others given the semi-constantly changing environment, which doesn't match Guix.
@fanquake That's a bit unfortunate, but makes sense. Maybe some day we can do a guix build in the CI.

### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#25391](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25391) ([POC] guix: Use LTO to build releases by fanquake)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

issue.title: guix: Use LTO to build releases
issue.body: Changes required to get LTO working for release (Guix) builds.

I used the following script to get the union of the list of exports of all considered targets:
```
$ ./symbol-closure.py */bin/*
```
which is:
```python
#!/usr/bin/env python3
import sys
import lief

def list_exported_symbols(binary):
    for symbol in binary.dynamic_symbols:
        if not symbol.exported:
            continue
        name = symbol.name
        if binary.header.machine_type == lief.ELF.ARCH.RISCV: # RISCV exports all kinds of symbols but is ignored
            continue
        yield name

if __name__ == '__main__':
    all_exports = set()
    for filename in sys.argv[1:]:
        binary = lief.parse(filename)
        if binary.format == lief.EXE_FORMATS.ELF:
            all_exports.update(list_exported_symbols(binary))

    print(all_exports)
```
this gives the output:
```
['__environ', '_environ', '_fini', '_init', 'environ', 'stderr', 'stdin', 'stdout']
```
Which is exactly what this PR adds.

Tested ACK 84e56b45b45e6c79331de59eab5d394eb2655538
